reviews.review_msg: Honestly, no. Stay away from this class; the TA yuan marks so hard. You'll have a 1600-word essay, and he will make sure something that you spent 3 days on gets a 70%. and when asked about it, he gets flustered. I asked him to remark on my midterm and went from a C- to an A- because he "overlooked" portions.

Honestly stay away from this prof and the TA yuan. it's not worth it. she's kind but can't teach professionally speaking. And yuan is nice, but honestly useless when it comes to asking for help. I wanted this class as a GPA booster... never mind.

Cristina is really kind. Her lectures are easy to follow and understand as long as you have done the readings. Besides this, this is a very tough marker and provides little criteria making it difficult to get a good grade. Shes nice, but I dont see myself taking another class with her.

I think some of these reviews of prof Moretti are a little harsh.
I will admit you do need to make an effort on the assignments but they were never unreasonable. 
The TA Yuan was really great for this class as well. 
If you listen and make the effort you will get a decent grade.
Lectures were also very interesting. I learned a lot.

I love Cristina. She's so sweet and genuinely cares about her students. I took SA364 with her and decided to take another SA course the following semester because she a great a prof. Attendance was mandatory and every class had a writing response activity although it was more of a pass/fail basis and basically was done for attendance.
Prof. Moretti is extremely nice, lots of readings but course material is interesting and she really cares about her students :)

She seems sweet as a person and does sympathize on a few things. Though majority of the time not responsive with her emails at all which sucks because her criteria is not clear and is tough grader. took this class as an elective. there is lots of reading but you could manage just skimming. Two big assignments are written essays. sooo

I have absolutely nothing against this professor as a person; she is very sweet and caring, and really cares about student wellbeing. I just had a really tough time following what this class was trying to explain. Lectures were a bit confusing and unstructured, and involved a lot of group activities that didn't always seem to have relevance.

The course is quite lecture heavy, Cristina is very nice however lacks to explain criteria that she expects in papers and what she is looking for. The grading is very tough, and the course is heavy as there is weekly readings & quizzes.

Thought about minoring in Anthropology. After her class, not anymore. Online, but gave too many videos/readings per week and too many discussions/projects. She sounds sweet in-person but had the most confusing questions for weekly discussions.

She is very caring and wants her students to know as much as possible about anthropology. But she is a very tough grader, getting more than 65% is nearly impossible. She gives a TON of lecture material which involves videos, books to read and her lecture videos. Even if you do your best, you will not be able to get a decent grade whatsoever.

This was supposed to be an interesting course, I actually wanted to learn. However the content was so heavy, way too much readings and not enough time. Please keep your expectations low for this course. Grading is extremely tough and doesnt give clear feedback on how to do better (I even went to office hours for help which was absolutely useless).

This was a horrible class. Prof morreti is extremely tough on grading and doesn't give you a clear grading criteria (for one of the assignments we weren't even given one!). Way too much reading for a 100 level course. I can honestly say I have learned absolutely nothing from this class and would not recommend it to anyone. Defo not a gpa booster.

Professor Moretti as a person is very nice. However, this class is hard to get a good mark in because the TA marks super hard. The TA makes no sense. She wants you to write things in your assignment that do not even relate to what you are talking about. There is no clear grading criteria. This class turned me off from doing an anthropology major.

I don't usually post bad reviews but prof. Moretti is an exception. Although she's not that bad of a prof but her grading criteria are ridiculously tough. The TA marks really tough too. They expect you to give specific answers to open questions. What's the point of anthropology if we are being limited to answers that aren't taught that clearly?

possibly the worst 100 level class you could take. the prof is knowledgable but doesn't give anyone a grade above 90 which is absurd. there's too much reading from 3 separate textbooks!! lengthy assignments that are only worth 5-10%, and she still manages to give you a horrible mark. do yourself a favour and don't take her class

So much reading. Too much. Asks her TAs to be especially tough on grading. Was near impossible to get above an 86% as the prof doesn't want to skew the bell curve-- ridiculous really. Take course with someone else.

Professor Moretti is really nice and truly wants you to learn and do well. But the course itself is ridiculously difficult- the readings are long (>40 pages per week) and the quizzes are tricky. The papers and presentations seem okay but she grades very toughly. This is the most amount of work I have done for a 100 level class. Don't recommend

Clear and concise guidelines for papers.  There were readings but this is a university 100 level course and the readings are there but not particularly hard.  You should not take unless you are interested in lively discussion.
She's very kind and a fair marker. Her criticism/feedback is pretty helpful. Quite a bit of reading, though. Make sure to read everything she assigns if you want to do well.
Heavy course material. Expect a lot of readings. Unclear grading criteria and exams were very difficult and specific to the text.
Great Class! Loved her, she is very kind and obviously love what she does. Come to every class and you will do great! make sure you do the readings!

Cristina is extremely nice, but the course work is too much for an intro course.  There was a textbook chapter, an ethnography chapter, and an article to read every week, with a term paper replacing the midterm.  She didn't talk about the paper at all and it was worth 35%.  Make sure to read everything she assigns because the final is on EVERYTHING

Cristina is a nice person however her expectations for a first year class were a bit too high. The textbook that was used was very hard to study from because it was like a story. She wanted us to write an anthropological essay without having taught us how to do so. The workload is also way too much and time consuming.
Very helpful and fair professor. Highly recommended.
Good teacher. Good feedback.

As others have mentioned, the workload of this class is quite heavy and the percentages allocated to different assignments are a bit askew. However, Cristina is a very nice professor and is willing to help when necessary.

Ugh what can I say? She is a very nice professor but this particular class is tough to enjoy sometimes. Her "study notes" section feels unfair considering how much time you have to put into them each week. The content is a little boring and goes round and round sometimes in discussion. But always take something out of the class.

Cristina is very nice as a person but her workload is crazy. For this class, there were 6 three page essays, 2 nine page essays, a presentation, a poster, and attendance. She marks the small papers only A, C, or F. She also told me that since she has 60 students, she didn't have time to give me much feedback on my papers. Overall, hard class.

Christina is approachable and seems to have a high interest in the subject. She likes talking about Milan a lot! Her class arrangement is decent and the four hours were divided well with a variety of class discussion, lectures and video. However, there is a lack of clarity with the assignments and I would like to have learnt more about Anthropology

She really likes her material, and is a nice person. But tbh her class is ridiculous. The TA was incredibly hard marker, you get no information on how to do anything, and nothing she seemed to talk about actually had any relevance to current anthropology let alone the assignments we were supposed to do.Interesting class, but almost impossible.
Cute, fun, and good teacher
